result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J. Wetterau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM212.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary J. Wetterau

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary J. Wetterau in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CM212, 15CM37

State files Statement of Uncharge Read-in. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters Judgment of Convictions in 14CM212. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  15CM37 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM37 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 
Court accepts the Statement of Uncharged Read-in.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions defendant. 
Atty Kuhl makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM212 Count 1 - 
Serve 75 days jail, STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for 18 months:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharges. 
No contact with Rachel Cooney unless approved by his agent. 
Count 1 only - Perform 30 hours community service.  To be served with the Portage County Parks department. 
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or combination thereof.
Not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 

14CM212 Count 2 - 
Serve 75 days jail, STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for 18 months, concurrent with Count 1:
Pay restitution of $70.00.
All other conditions of Count 1 apply except the community service. 

15CM37 -
Serve 90 days jail, consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving. STAYED
20 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM212. 
Pay costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse surcharges. 

Court advises of postconviction relief.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary J. Wetterau
Current: 1600 Briggs Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2015)
Prior: 2401 Water Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
to Golden County Foods re: wage assignment
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

$750 cash bond Amended:  Wage assignment $200 every two weeks pay period until $750 cash bond is paid on deposit with the Clerk of Court.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Rachel Cooney
Do not possess any dangerous weapons

Defendant Zachary J. Wetterau appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brandon Kuhl in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Atty Kuhl ask for bond reduction.
BY THE COURT:  $750 cash bond Amended:  Wage assignment $200 every two weeks pay period until $750 cash bond is paid on deposit with the Clerk of Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Rachel Cooney
Do not possess any dangerous weapons

Clerk is Shelley
1:35 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA  Cousins  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct Domestic and Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  Initial Appearance February 16, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2.
